content.description: Access to this climb crosses the gully right below Upstairs and goes through a notch in the rock behind an oak tree. Another smaller gully goes past a blocky chimney to the Squirrel Crack and the mid-pitch double cracks of Silly Pinnacle. The Squirrel Crack follows large cracks and flake roofs to a large, 6‚Äù+, off-width leading to a bolt belay with a small stance. You will notice from the belay that bolts and a crack ledge lead right. This alternate climb leads to the final bolt ladder of the Silly Pinnacle. The free climbing traverse to the bolt ladder is about 5.8 and can be done as one pitch including the Squirrel Crack portion.
content.location: In the middle of the Silly Pinnacle.  Approach from main trail and follow the gully to the left that leads up and behind the silly pinnacle.

content.description:
A great mixed route to a cool summit.

The first pitch starts with a bolt-ladder that leads into a thin crack with two fixed pins. You can stem the tree to reach the first bolt. Continue aiding past the pins and a couple bolts until you get the left-leaning crack. This crack and two of the three bolts afterwards have been free climbed at 5.10, the crack takes small stoppers and TCU's. If you aid the crack you'll still have to make an exciting step out of your Aider to clip the next bolt. The pitch finishes with a low 5th traverse left to the anchor. 5.10 C1F or just C1F. 90'

The second pitch is a short but fun 5.7 fist to hand crack that is stout for it's grade, climb the crack for 40' and traverse left along a ledge and climb up a face with a small crack to the bolted anchor. 5.7 .55'

The third pitch is the cool aid pitch that starts with a large overhang that you surpass by aiding a left-leaning crack through it. That crack mostly accepted cams but the rock quality isn't the best so placements are suspect and an angle piton was helpful. There are two fixed pins as you come out of the overhang, check them before you trust them. A reachy bolt-ladder takes you to the summit. The bolt ladder requires a mantel and generous hero looping for those who aren't 6'. A2. 85'.

There is a fixed black rope you can use to rap of the back side of the pinnacle into the Gully. 15' rappel.
content.protection:
Nuts to 1/2" for the first pitch.

Nuts to 3" with two 3" pieces for the second pitch

TCUs to 1" for third pitch with 1/2-3/4" angles

Possibly a stick-clip if you are 5'7" or less
content.location: The direct route is the first route you'll come across when approaching Danland, look for the bolt-ladder just off the trail on the first large wall you come to.

content.description: Indian Walk consists of a few left-slanting cracks that you traverse upwards the entire climb. Balancy and precise footwork will be quite helpful throughout; at some points you'll be lie backing and underclinging the same crack you're stepping on. Some placements can be tricky to get because you'll be placing below your waist but the start, as well as, the transfer to the upper crack are protected by a couple bolts each.
content.protection: Two bolts for the thin start, two bolts for the transfer to the last crack, the rest is gear from Small fingers to 2". Two-bolt rap anchor at the top. A 60m rope reaches the ground.
content.location: Just left and down-hill from the silly pinnacle direct route start. The slanting crack is quite noticeable, look for the bolts at the start.

content.description:
The fisher traverse actually isn't on the silly pinnacle itself but it is accessed through the same approach. When you get to silly pinnacle, turn left and follow the trail until it ends on a ledge, the route starts here.

Around the corner there's a bolt on the face. You can clip this (extend it!) and step down and traverse across the crack with good foot and handholds until you can't go further, from there you'll start up a flake pull onto the flake (crux) and follow it to the top. The route has cool exposure because you're traversing across the top of another wall, Bear Rock.
content.protection:
From nuts to 2"

Long draws!

3 bolt rap anchor on top
content.location: When approaching the silly pinnacle, turn left at the wall and follow the trail ,passing Indian walk, untill you can go no further because it ends at a ledge that drops off. The route starts from here. The wall that this route is on is Bear Rock, it contains a number of routes.
